action.action-desc: Mr. Knight (for himself, Mr. Lipinski, Mr. Smith of Texas, Mr. Weber of Texas, and Mr. Hultgren) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Energy to carry out certain upgrades to research equipment and the construction of a research user facility, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Department of Energy Research Infrastructure Act of 2017.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Energy shall provide for the upgrade to the Advanced Light Source described in the publication approved by the Basic Energy Sciences Advisory Committee on June 9, 2016, titled Report on Facility Upgrades, including the development of a multi-bend achromat lattice to produce a high flux of coherent x-rays within the soft x-ray energy region.

paragraph.text: The term flux means the rate of flow of photons.
The term soft x-ray means a photon with energy in the range from 50 to 2,000 electron volts.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall, to the maximum extent practicable, ensure that the start of full operations of the upgrade under this section occurs before December 31, 2026.
Out of funds appropriated to the Office of Science, there shall be made available to the Secretary to carry out the upgrade under this section—

section.header: Linac Coherent Light Source II high energy upgrade

subsection.text: The Secretary of Energy shall provide for the upgrade to the Linac Coherent Light Source II facility described in the publication approved by the Basic Energy Sciences Advisory Committee on June 9, 2016, titled Report on Facility Upgrades, including the development of experimental capabilities for high energy x-rays to reveal fundamental scientific discoveries. The Secretary shall ensure the upgrade under this section enables the production and use of high energy, ultra-short pulse x-rays delivered at a high repetition rate.

paragraph.text: The term a high energy x-ray means a photon with an energy at or exceeding 12 kiloelectron volts.
The term high repetition rate means the delivery of x-ray pulses up to one million pulses per second.
The term ultra-short pulse x-rays means x-ray bursts capable of durations of less than one hundred femtoseconds.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall, to the maximum extent practicable, ensure that the start of full operations of the upgrade under this section occurs before December 31, 2025.
Out of funds appropriated to the Office of Science, there shall be made available to the Secretary to carry out the upgrade under this section—
The Secretary of Energy shall provide for a Facility for Rare Isotope Beams to advance the understanding of rare nuclear isotopes and the evolution of the cosmos.
In carrying out subsection (a), the Secretary shall provide for, at a minimum, a rare isotope beam facility capable of 400 kW of beam power.
The Secretary shall, to the maximum extent practicable, ensure that the start of full operations of the facility under this section occurs before June 30, 2022, with early operation in 2018.
Out of funds appropriated to the Office of Science, there shall be made available to the Secretary to carry out activities, including construction of the facility, under this section—
